Definitions of a lay follower [sn55.37:6: When you’ve gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, you’re considered to be a lay follower.
When a lay follower doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, they’re considered to be an ethical lay follower.
When a lay follower has faith in the Realized One’s awakening, they’re considered to be a faithful lay follower.
When a lay follower is generous, they’re considered to be a generous lay follower.
When a lay follower is wise, they’re considered to be a wise lay follower.
